Student: OK! Thanks
Teacher: So,  yes, of course, the UK has lots of social problems, some of them similar to the ones in China and some quite different. Itâ€™s the same idea with having a good pension for employees in the public sector. Some of them are very well-paid like doctors and others are underpaid and overworked like nurses, teachers and firefighters. A huge number of people work in the private sector, and they can still receive a state pension as long as they pay their taxes and also a pension from their company. I think the working hours are a bit more regulated. Employers understand that they need to keep employees happy. If employees are always exhausted, they will soon burn out and leave.
